Lily said, "Let's play with the dirty ball." Rose agreed, "Yes, let's play with it!" So, they started to play with the dirty ball, kicking it back and forth to each other.
As they played, their mom came outside and saw the dirty ball. She said, "Girls, that ball is dirty. Let's clean it up first." Lily and Rose listened to their mom and helped her clean the ball. After the ball was clean, they continued to play and had lots of fun together.

In the end, both of them were happy and became good friends.

Lily. "We will see who can collect the most rocks." Tom agreed, and they both started to look for rocks. They found big rocks, small rocks, and many colorful rocks. They put all the rocks in their jugs.
After some time, they stopped to count their rocks. Lily had ten rocks, and Tom had nine rocks. Lily said, "I have more rocks, but we both did a great job!" Tom smiled and said, "Yes, we did. Let's play again another day!" They both went home happy, with their jugs full of pretty rocks.

As Sammy watched Billy fly, he wanted to try flying too. He climbed to the top of the oak tree and jumped. But instead of flying, he just fell. Luckily, he landed on a soft pile of leaves.
